Tammy has done an amazing job transforming this downtown office buidling into an Airbnb oasis. She provided coffee, water, dishes, silverware, toiletries, a sound machine, a stand alone fan, an extension cord, streaming TV and very clear instructions on parking and staying there. I'm listing these items to make others aware, but I want to be clear that I don't consider any of these negatively. The bathroom was tiny and it has the only mirror, but for 2 of us it was fine. The rooms without an ensuite had use of a bigger bathroom. It was very bright in our room in the morning, but we both sleep with a mask on so this didn't bother us either. The beds and bedding were extremely soft, so we both slept great. We loved staying at barefoot creek, so we're going to book again in November.

Andrea has provided a cozy spot that makes you feel as though you have always belonged to the Stillwater and OSU community. Her Oklahoman hospitality rings true and is a testament to the care Andrea has taken to make your stay comfortable, safe, and quiet for the "sleepy" traveler.

ALL TIME FAVORITE!
This was one of the best Airbnb homes we’ve ever stayed in. My wife, two sons and I had an amazing time here! The cabin is cozy, and a perfect size for our family. The home is about a seven minute drive to town, and only about ten minutes from Walmart if you need anything. The bed and couch bed are comfy, the AC works great, and the bathroom is huge. The kitchen has all amenities you’d need to cook meals too. We spent a lot of time on the front porch while it rained and stayed dry. Plus there’s a nice fire pit if you want that one evening.
But the cool part is you’re far enough out and secluded (minus the other cabin next door) that you feel isolated and away from it all. You’re surrounded by lush trees, grasses and flowers that allow you to relax and slow down. Plus plenty of birds chirping and frogs croaking to make you feel like you’re in the middle of nowhere. Bonus: tons of fireflies at night!
Plus, there’s a private pond right behind your cabin! We fished on and off for four days and caught tons of bluegill and a few bass. My son caught his first fish on this trip too!
As for the hosts, you couldn’t ask for better. They were super fast at responding, and were extremely helpful. This was hands down one of our favorite Airbnb stays to date! Our son might have thrown a little fit when we told him we had to go home today! Can’t wait to go back. If you’re considering this place, do it! You’ll be as happy as we were.

The place itself was the absolute cutest place I’ve stayed. The best decorated and well thought out. Very welcoming hosts.
All that said, while it was pretty, the mattress is rock hard and I could not sleep. I’m not asking for a temperpedic or anything, but I would like to not feel like I’m sleeping on a wood floor. Renting an Airbnb has one purpose, and that is to have a place to rest. I had to be up there for one evening, and since I had to get up at 3:45 AM to drive back for work the next day, I wanted a place to sleep to avoid falling asleep on the road back. I maybe got 2 hours of sleep because of the mattress.
There are no curtains, so I also felt like people could look though the windows. There are blinds, just not that added security of curtains.
Being by myself, I didn’t feel safe in that neighborhood.
Again, super duper cute— just didn’t serve the purpose of rest that I desperately needed and missed out on for the rest of the work week.
